results.title: The Magician
results.creator_credit: Allan Ekelund, Svensk Filmindustri and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: A 19th century hypnotist, Dr Vogler (Max Von Sydow), and his wife Manda (Ingrid Thulin), dressed as a man are scrutinised and ridiculed by Dr Vergerus (Gunnar Bjornstrand) due to sceptisicm towards their “magic” performance. Vogler seeks retribution for this humiliation by performing the greatest conjuring trick of them all- faking his own death. Vogler’s actions lead to the murder of a local constable who later returns to haunt the dead. Described as “a thinking man’s horror movie”, this film was awarded Special Jury and Cinema Nuovo Prizes at the Venice Film Festival, 1959. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Magical world of J.K. Rowling
results.creator_credit: Video Release Productions and Steven Grant
results.brief_description: Winner of the British Book Awards prestigious Author of the Year award in 1999, J.K. (Joanne Kathleen) Rowling, a single mother with a young daughter, is responsible for creating one of the most popular children’s series in modern times. Her tales of young wizard Harry Potter, and his adventures at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry have been translated into 25 different languages. This documentary discusses where the idea for Harry came from and where it all began. Also includes interviews with childhood friends of the author, literary critics, bookstore owners and children, asking for their views on the Harry Potter phenomenon.

results.title: The Magic wire
results.creator_credit: Athol Shmith Cine Unit, Olympic Cables and John Scott Simmons
results.brief_description: A study of the processes of manufacturing wire of various gauges and for various purposes, and of heavy duty cables.

results.title: The Magic well
results.brief_description: An adaptation of the Grimm Brothers fairy tale “Frau Holle”, in which two sisters journey to an enchanted land where kindness is rewarded by Mother Holle. Shows how the girls’ jouneys have very different results.

results.title: The Magic tree
results.creator_credit: Gerald McDermott and Landmark Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “African folklore”.
A haunting tale from the Congo about Movgumgu, a homely, unloved boy who leaves his family for a lonely river voyage. Relates his experiences with a Magic Tree which he finds in a river clearing.

results.title: The Magic touch
results.creator_credit: V. Shantaram, Films Division, Government of India and Mushir Ahmad
results.brief_description: A visual impression of Indian arts and crafts, recording the skill of the country’s artisans. Shows filigree from Cuttack and Hyderabad, the enamelled brassware of Moradabad, Jaipur and Lucknow, bronze figures from South India, ivory models wrought in Mysore and Travancore, the papiermache work from Kashmir.

results.title: The Magic sword: quest for Camelot
results.creator_credit: Dalisa Cohen, Warner Bros Pictures and Frederick DuChan
results.brief_description: Set in the time of King Arthur, a renegade knight sets out to seize power by stealing the sword Excalibur. Brave Hayley, who longs to become a knight, sets out together with a young blind hermit, a dragon and a falcon, to foil his plot, recover the magic sword, and save the kingdom. Featuring the voices of Cary Elwes, Gary Oldman, Eric Idle, Pierce Brosnan and Sir John Gielgud.

results.title: The Magic square
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and General Learning Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents basic mathematical concepts. Crow and the Count travel to Scotland to claim an inherited castle. The benefactor has left a fortune to the person who can solve the mystery of the magic square. This the two friends do after much juggling of numbers; the reshuffling illustrates the interchangeability of addends in an addition equation (associative property). Previewing recommended for follow-up work for teachers. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The magic school bus explores the solar system (PC)
results.brief_description: Take an interplanetary adventure as the Magic School Bus blasts off into the solar system. Ms Frizzle gets lost in space! It’s your mission to collect clues, discover the secrets of the solar system, and find the friz to win the game. SYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS version 5.1 ot later, Microsoft Windows, version 3.1 or later.

results.title: The Magic school bus explores the human body (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Ms. Frizzle and the class on a wacky trip into Arnold’s body. Along the way you will explore how the human body works as you discover a way out of Arnold and win the game. STYSTEMS REQUIREMENTS: A multimedia PC or compatible with a 486SX or higher microprocessor, 25MHz, 4MB of RAM, at least 5MB of available hard-disk space, double speed CDROM drive, 8-bit audio board, and SVGA display capable of 256 colours. MS-DOS operating system version 5.0 or later. Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.
